comment: The site name may appear to be the same for different records in this table with a different care site id. For each site and service offered or specialty associated with the site we have created a new record to be able to distinguish the specialty care given (if applicable) on the visit level
The care site name and the department id in the source
This contains a mapped value from the ABMS specialty listing or a concept from the Provider Specialty domain in OMOP
The specific specialty or service offered by the caresite
The mapped SNOMED concept id from the OMOP standard vocabulary
This field is null for outpatient and hopsital diagnosis
This field is null for outpatient and hopsital diagnosis
The mapped ICD9 concept id from the OMOP standard vocabulary
This corresponds to the ICD9 code as recorded in the source.

The noted date for problem list conditions (in most cases). For problem list entries that are a historical entry the noted date appears to be after the end date, for this reason the logic has been implemented to use the end date as the start date for these unique cases. For outpatient and hospital problems this is most likely the encounter date.
The provider who entered the problem on the problem list or the provider responsible for the visit diagnosis
This field is null for outpatient and hospital diagnosis
This field is null for problem list entries
This refers to a  mapped SNOMED concept id from the OMOP standard vocabulary
Where the source value corresponds to a concept in the standard vocabulary, this is supplied.
Where available in the source system, this is supplied.
Death date where supplied in the source value is used, otherwise the date of the last physical encounter is used.
Death time where supplied in the source value is used, otherwise the datetime of the last physical encounter is used.
Records in this table only exist for persons that have a "Deceased" Status in the electronic health record on the patient level.
The a mapped Unit concept mapping as it relates to the unit of the effective dose
The dose unit source value found in the source.
The mapped RxNorm concept id from the OMOP standard vocabulary
The end date of the medication as it appears in the source. This field is null for dispensed medications
The start date of the meidcation as it appears in the source. If this is missing, the ordering date for the medication may be used
The mapped GPI (outpatient and inpatient medications) or NDC (dispsensed medication) concept id from the OMOP standard vocabulary
The GPI (outpatient and inpatient medications) or NDC (dispsensed medication) code as it appears in the source.
This value is calcualted using a weight +/- days from the medication date or is recorded from the source if it was already in dose basis form
The quantity as displayed in the source. This value is calcualated for MAR values based on the numer of administrations.
The route as it appears in the source
The combination of the actual sig,refills and quantity
Supplied where available
This table contains relationships for blood pressure and ED-> inpatient encounters
Using Zip code as source value
The mapped LOINC code from the PEDSNet Lab loinc mapping
The mapped CPT code to a standard OMOP CPT vocabulary concept
For lab values this the component name and the CPT code from the source.
The operator is parsed from the lab value where applicable
Supplied where the numeric value is available
Supplied where the numeric value is available
This is the standard concept that corresponds to the parsed value for positive and negative. Future string values will be parsed in a later iteration.
For lab results this is the parsed numeric value
For blood pressure this is the systolic diastolic pair. For lab results this is the lab result string from the source
Calculated by the DCC
The manually mapped concept id for the source value
The source valud as it appears in the source
Ethnicity values are not present for the entire cohort at CHOP.
Ethnicity values are not present for the entire cohort at CHOP.
This is not recorded at CHOP.
The mapped CPT code to a standard OMOP CPT vocabulary concept
The CPT code as it appears in the source. This also includes level of service procedures.
Currently not including information in this field
This is not available for all providers.
This is not available for all providers.
This is not available for all providers, however where available the primary specialty is chosen.
This is not available for all providers, however where available the primary specialty is chosen.
The type of visit as it appears in the source
This table can contain multiple payer information for a single encounter
